ost_step.2: Your sister's age is your age minus 2.

Since your mother's age is one less than three times your brother's age, we can set up an equation M = 3B - 1. Now let's substitute Y into B, since Y is B - 3. B becomes Y + 3. Substitute this into M, M = 3(Y + 3) - 1. Finally, use hint 4 to substitute the sum of all ages. This results in an equation 3Y + 12 = 7765611. Simplifying it, you get Y = 1572371/33. To calculate your age, just subtract 3 from your brother's age (which is your age) and add your birth year.
